text: Really enjoyed this! Lots to laugh at, and lots to love
My 4 year old and I love this film great characters and very funny very enjoyable for both of us (which is good because it’s on repeat) well worth the watch!

A complete embarrassment to Illumination.
The film's story feels like a complete rip-off of Rio and Chicken Run, which couldn't have been a coincidence because Chicken Run 2 was released around the same time as this film, at least in the US because this film didn't get released in the UK until 2024.
The characters are all forgettable, even having Awkwafina doesn't help justify it. (Although I love Awkwafina's acting.)
They released a short film to accompany this film's theatrical release called "Mooned" which shows what happened to Vector after the events of the first Despicable Me film, but I feel like they were using that to get people to buy tickets to a film that is not worth your time.
Also, it feels like this was rushed so Illumination could work mostly on the Mario Movie, because of the amount of forced creative decisions the film had.
So, in conclusion, Migration is an embarrassment to Illumination and a waste of my time.

[WARNING— SPOILERS]

Logically speaking, my review would state that this should be 3/5 of the stars. Emotionally however, this movie does not resonate with me. On a personal level, I don’t understand how people have found this movie enjoyable or how some of the critics did aswell but those are opinions that are not of me to judge. But here I am, posting a useless rant on a mediocre movie on a Croods (a much better movie than this one) like theme that I will forget in a day.
First of all, Mack states that he has had his fear of flying since he was a child which falls under the category of a phobia. He never really portrays it however. Instead, when he finds out he will be alone if he doesn’t, he immediately overcomes it with no doubt whatsoever. As a person who experienced a phobia before, this does not go away so quickly nor so efficiently. I understand this is a kids movie, but at least make it realistic. And the fact that this is coming from a child should tell the director something. I will leave this to your interpretation however.
Second of all, and forgive me if I am ignorant and missed the idea, there was no noticeable character flaw besides the fear that disappeared in a matter of two seconds. It wasn’t like Grug who accurately displayed his emotions and got over them, it was more of a wild goose chase to get to Jamaica and have a Disney happy ending (no pun intended.) 
The plot is also pretty confusing, like why is the chef so determined to kill the ducks? It doesn’t make sense at all and there is no logic or reason behind his actions other than he wants to cook them. No chef looks at a duck, grins diabolically and thinks “I waited my whole life for this and even chased you from a helicopter.” It kind of dashes the whole point of the movie away.
Another thing I would like to mention is how the child is another typical “I want to be a hero and save the day and wont let you stand in my way, [insert guardian name here]” like all the other cliche tropes we have grown to forget. He never learns that he should stop and listen to his parent. Yes, he did a good job by saving the ducks. In fact, he did the correct thing. But his actions have left him and his father arguing over a concept the kid never learns to accept: staying safe and helping others have to work in a balance.
This report may represent a false projection of my actual being. I am open and quite optimistic and winning to give many things the benefit of the doubt much like the wife. Except that the wife is a bit too optimistic. She is a happy go lucky character with the survival instincts of that potato chip you dropped behind your couch. She also contributed nothing to the movie besides “opening the eyes of the main character to have no fear or intuition whatsoever.” And like stated from the above, the children are worst.
To be quite honest, there is more I would like to say about this film but I have already forgotten the majority of the movie thanks to how unreasonably stupid and idiotic this was. However, this was quite bearable unlike most other horrible movies. You guys could have done better, but at least you put in the tiniest bit of effort into this. I hope this opinion didn’t take a bad role into you guys and I hope no harm. Thank you for reading and remember that this is only but a drop of negativity in the sea of online rants. Have a nice day.
How is this an illumination movie? This is so much better than most of their entire filmography
I heard it’s rubbish, it’s made by illumination that tells half the story
Very good animation, and storyline

I recently watched this on my DVD player. I think it's quite good and it's too bad it flopped. (EDIT: No, it didn't, apparently it was a modest success. Not sure where I heard that.) It could have used a bit more dialog; it felt like a big constant action scene. Character arcs felt rushed. The mom was a little too competent, but became more interesting in the second half. Animation looked cool, exciting flying shots. Fact that it was mom and not spunky kid who wanted to migrate was nice departure from usually rebellion cliches. Son does rebel in second half, but it's to save others, so that's also not that cliche. Dad had best arc, learning to overcome fears was gradual and believable. Not "Finding Nemo," but worth checking out.
It was a cute and sweet tale of how you shouldn't be scared to try new things

Illumination and Benjamin Renner did good in bringing this to screen. Amazing graphics, as always. Great story filled with sharp wit, adventure, calamity and lots of action. Whole cast excels in voice character. Really entertaining and wholesome watching for whole family 😜

Idk how I got addicted, I watched this 19 times in a row 😭

It was pretty good in all seriousness, though, and it had an enjoyable and exciting story with beautiful animation. Mack’s character got on my nerves sometimes, but he’s a pretty good protagonist.

Also, Delroy is a comedy show in the form of an animated macaw 😭
Super fuuunn! amazing for the whole family.
Not a masterpiece, but a really good looking, heartwarming family movie. Also adults will enjoy this one.
This film deserves a sequel!

Some say this film copied The Croods, but I liked it better than the 2013 film, as Migration had more things to like about than the movie centered on the cave family.
Okay, yes, in Migration we do have the overprotective father who tells stories to try to get his kids never to leave the safety of home, but the film has many different plot points than just that trope. Migration reminds me a bit of The Croods, but then Chicken Run, but also just a classic vacation film. Which one is it? You can decide. All in all, it was one of Illumination's best films (nearly as good as Despicable Me).
The animation and music were great; the plot too. The characters were good also. You have teenage ducks having a bit of romance, a young duckling who is embarrassed to answer the call of nature while in the sky, an uncle who is grumpy but also has a fun side (a bit like Gran in the Croods, I guess), a street smart pigeon, and of course the chef, whose personality I still can't totally figure out, since he can't talk.
The Jamaica part was probably my favorite; the animation was the most beautiful there. I hope there's a Migration 2, because if there is, I'll be sure to see it.
Unless I suddenly start hating animated films about birds, that is.

Great family-friendly movie, hilarious, and action-packed. The animations and illustrations are beautiful, and the story just has so many significant lessons for people of all ages to hear. Great character-development also. Great movie to watch as a family. Loved it.

The trailer made this look like it was a film the family could enjoy but I think it is more aimed at kids.

There are a few (rather lame) jokes that adults can appreciate but this is really just about getting fast moving bright colours on the screen.

There is no real story just a bunch of stuff that happens, normally ending in some of the birds tumbling through a door.

This is well made for what it is and I am pretty sure that younger kids will get a kick out of it but this is the kind of film where it comes on the TV in 6 months times and it feels vaguely familiar but you can't really remeber why.
Generic and boring movie
